metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6556 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
lxc-user-nic when asked to delete a network interface will unconditionallyopen a user provided path. This code path may be used by an unprivilegeduser to check for the existence of a path which they wouldn't otherwise beable to reach. It may also be used to trigger side effects by causing a(read-only) open of special kernel files (ptmx, proc, sys). Affectedreleases are LXC: 2.0 versions above and including 2.0.9; 3.0 versionsabove and including 3.0.0, prior to 3.0.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6556` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblxc1 - 2.0.8-0ubuntu1~16.04.2
lua-lxc - 2.0.8-0ubuntu1~16.04.2
lxc - 2.0.8-0ubuntu1~16.04.2
lxc-common - 2.0.8-0ubuntu1~16.04.2
lxc-templates - 2.0.8-0ubuntu1~16.04.2
lxc-tests - 2.0.8-0ubuntu1~16.04.2
lxc1 - 2.0.8-0ubuntu1~16.04.2
python3-lxc - 2.0.8-0ubuntu1~16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lxc package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.8-0ubuntu1~16.04.2').
